sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Jacques de Vitry, Historia orientalis. Willelmus de Rubruk OFM, Itinerarium ad partes orientales. pseudo-John of Damascus, Barlaam et Iosaphat
msDesc.p: Vellum, 300 208 , 11.7 x 8.2, in double columns of 39 lines. Cent. xii (xiii?) and xiv.

p. 115 blank, on p. 116 list of contents (xvi) and also a piece of parchment pasted on inscribed (xiv-xv): J. 90.
Liber de communitate monachorum Sancti Edmundi in quo subscripta continentur.
List of contents (9-24). The MS. Ff. I. 27 in the University Library, given by Archbishop Parker, contains (Art. 19-29) the latter part of this volume.
James provides a full listing of the contents for two manuscripts, one from Sawley and one from Bury St. Edmunds, each of which had been split in half and rebound - the first half of the Sawley with the first half of the Bury, second half of Sawley with second half of Bury - into MS 66 and Cambridge University Library Ff. 1. 27 respectively. James' MS 66 has since been separated again (rebound in 1954 by John Gray) so that James' Volume I (the Sawley portion) is now MS 66 and James' Volume II (the Bury portion) is now MS 66A.
James lists the following contents for the complete Bury MS., which is currently divided between MS 66A and CUL Ff. 1. 27:
CCC 66 (now CCCC MS 66A):
Jacobus de Vitriaco
Willelmus Rubruc
Journey of Macarius
Imago mundi Liber I
Prester John
Johannes de Sacro bosco de sphera
Barlaam and Josaphat
Imago mundi Liber II
Story of the Cross
French poem thereon
Infancy of Christ. French verse
Tracts on the Holy Land
Stories of Pilate and Judas
Miracles
pseudo-Methodius
ULC Ff. I 27:
Giraldus Cambrensis Descriptio Hiberniae
Giraldus Cambrensis Vaticinalis historia
Life of Patrick
Giraldus Cambrensis Descriptio Cambriae (xvi)
Prophecies
Giraldus Cambrensis Itinerarium Cambriae
Patrick's Purgatory
Extract from Chronicle of Sigebert
Prophecy of Merlin
Life of St David
Gaufredus de Fontibus (xv) de infantia Sancti Edmundi
For the complete list of contents given by James for both manuscripts, please see the following figure:

msItem.head: Jacques de Vitry, Historia orientalis

head.title: Historia Ierosolimitana abbreviata

msItem.head: (Iacobi de Vitriaco), Historia Jerosolimitana abbreviata Liber I
msItem.ab:
in red with blue initials.
Capitula of item no. 9 (now item no. 1) in red followed by three blank pages.
New foliation then begins
msItem.incipit: Terra sancta promissionis deo amabilis

ab.decoNote: Initial with gold ground. Monk with pastoral staff offers book to Bishop with cross

msItem.explicit: de die in diem expectantes

ab.ref: Bongars Gesta Dei per Francos, p. 1047

msItem.head: Willelmus de Rubruk OFM, Itinerarium ad partes orientales

head.title: Itinerarium terrae Tartarorum per W. de Rubruc

msItem.incipit: Excellentissimo domino et christianissimo Lodovico dei gracia Regi francorum illustri Frater W. de Rubruc

ab.decoNote: Initial: above two friars offer a book to king on R. (half-length below), two friars with staves walk to R.

msItem.explicit: plures interpretes et copiosas expensas etc.
msItem.ab: Also in MS 181. 9, MS 407. 2. Ed. by D'Avezac 1839 etc.

head.title: Itinerarium usque ad paradisum terrestrem

msItem.incipit: Gloria et magnificencia deo soli benignissimo

ab.decoNote: Initial. Three monks in black facing R.

msItem.explicit: uiuit et ubique regnat deus benedictis et laudabilis nunc et semper per immensa secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.ab: An earlier copy from Bury is in MS. Bodl. e Mus. 26

msItem.explicit: commendat tradicio
msItem.incipit: Mundus dicitur quasi
msItem.explicit: rex angelorum regnans per omnia secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.rubric: Explicit prima pars libri qui dicitur ymago mundi. Queratur secunda pars inferius post gesta Barlaam et Josaphat ad hoc signum

msItem.rubric: Incipit secunda pars libri qui dicitur ymago mundi et debet subsequi suam primam partem superius ad hoc signum
msItem.incipit: Priori libello globum
msItem.explicit: Lotharius regnum anno xii menses iii dies xii in christo fidelissimus constans pacificus miles inperteritus

msItem.explicit: Nicholaus IIIus Martinus IIIus (IV) (1281)

head.title: Legend of the Cross Before Christ
De arbore vitae in paradiso, historia fabulosa
Story of the Cross

msItem.ab: (W. Meyer, Abh. bayer. Akad. XVI, ii, 131)
msItem.incipit: Post peccatum ade expulso eo de paradyso

ab.decoNote: Initial gold ground. Christ beardless stands on L., on R. sits Adam with hand to head (sleeping): Eve emerges from his side

msItem.explicit: In ea quidem crucifixerunt domini nostri Ihesum Christum in salutem omnium sane credencium qui factus est obediens patri usque ad mortem, cui est laus et honor et imperium per omnia secula seculorum. Amen

head.title: Seth or The Holy Rood in Verse
Versus Gallici de eadem re

msItem.ab: French poem on the same, one of many versions

lg.l: De nos pechez nus doint remissiun
Ni eit nul ke amen ne die

head.title: Childhood of Jesus
Versus Gallici de eadem re
Infancy of Christ; an extract

msItem.ab: full text in MS. Selden supra 38: see Romania XV 334 (P. Meyer)

lg.l: En cel tens ke herodes saueit
Ke nul sur ly ne regnereit

msItem.ab: Narrates Flight into Egypt, meeting with beasts, tree bowing, child fallen from house-top raised up (124 lines)

lg.l: E deus nus doint issi loer

msItem.incipit: Fuit in diebus herodis regis poncio pilato preside uir in iudea nomine ruben

head.title: Visio Rodulfi
Visio revelata anno 1209 Rodulpho sacristae monasterii Cesarea sive Keisam nuncupati in territorio Augustensis ecclesiae

msItem.rubric: Hec uisio reuelata est anno uerbi incarnati mo. cco. ixo. sec
msItem.incipit: In regno Allemann' in Sweuie prouincia in territorio augustensis ecclesie situm est monasterium quoddam ordonis cisterciensis cesarea nuncupatum ... Keisam uero uulgari sermone
msItem.explicit: rex seculorum uisibiliter humilitate pertractandum. qui est super omnia benedictis in secula. Amen

head.title: De Stephano monacho cartusiensi

De Stephano monacho cartusiensi, qualiter eum beata virgo primo eripuit de naufragio corporis, et postea de temptationibus cordis; qualiter eum formam orandi docuit, quia ei devotus in seculo extiterat

msItem.incipit: Quidam clericus nomine Stephanus secundum seculi dignitatem preclarus
msItem.explicit: sperantes in te letificas. Qui cum unigenito tuo regnas et gloriaris in secula seculorum. Amen

msItem.head: pseudo-Methodius, Revelations

head.title: Liber Methodii episcopi Paterensis et martyris Christi quem ex Hebraeo et Graeco in Latinum transferre curavit, id est de principio seculi et inter regna gentium et fine seculorum, quem illustris vir beatus Jeronimus in suis opusculis collaudavit

msItem.rubric: In Christi nomine incipit liber etc.
msItem.incipit: Sciendum namque est nobis fratres karissimi quomodo in principio
msItem.explicit: eripere dignetur qui cum patre et spiritu sancto uiuit et regnat deus per infinita secula seculorum. Amen
msItem.ab: Printed in Orthodoxographa; last by E. Sackur, Sibyllinische Texte, 1898
blank covered with paper (This paper has been removed since James's time.)
